item.title: Principles For Data Recovery
item.description: Data Recovery is a complex topic to manage. Recovery Point Objectives are defined by business teams. Not all organisations are convinced that there is a reasonable need to mitigate complex data issues post an extreme disruption such as a cyber attack, this can be evidenced in the following paper created as a joint exercise between SIFMA and Protiviti: Protiviti https://www.protiviti.com/gl-en/insights-paper/principles-for-data-recovery-severe-cyber-scenario

item.title: Cloud Disaster Recovery
item.description: Disaster Recovery in the Cloud A guide for the selection of disaster recovery strategies when deploying applications in cloud environments. The availability and fast provisioning capabilities of external cloud providers has led to a desire to use these services for the development and hosting of applications. This paper outlines the acceptable practices for the utilisation of these environments to retain policy compliance. It does not cover Security & Data protection requirements, nor does it cover low level strategies or solutions to meet Resilience requirements which will be expanded on in a later paper.

item.title: UK Operational Resilience Regulations
item.description: UK Banking Regulators publish final Operational Resilience Policy Having spent a fair chunk of my time over the last two years on both direct feedback on Operational Resilience and working collaboratively with peers on some of the implementation standards, it’s pleasing to see the influence that work has had on the final policies. Analysis to come later, but the links are here: Statement of Policy – Outlines where the Operational Resilience Policy sits within the context of Governance, Operational Risk, Business Continuity and Outsourcing policies.

item.title: About
item.description: My name is George Fraser, I currently work for one of the largest International Banks in the world as the Director of Operational Resilience Frameworks. This role covers the development of resilience strategy and the design of globally consistent frameworks which ensure a continuous focus on resilience. Since 2006 I’ve been working to improve resilience within the financial services sector, helping to ensure that large banks meet their moral and societal expectations in the provision of banking services.
